intro: Chrysopsis divaricata, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chrysopsis divaricata is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 inches, with narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy.
